meanings.definition: Relating to or derived from the endoderm.
meanings.sent1: The entodermal cells formed the inner layer of the embryo.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the entodermal development of the organism.
meanings.sent3: The entodermal layer was like the cozy interior of a tiny house.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness had an entodermal effect on everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The entodermal nature of the soil made it perfect for growing roots.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the innermost of the three primary germ layers of an embryo.
meanings.sent1: The entodermal tissue gave rise to the digestive system.
meanings.sent2: Doctors observed the entodermal development in the early stages of pregnancy.
meanings.sent3: The entodermal layer was like the secret treasure chest of the embryo.
meanings.sent4: His words had an entodermal impact on her emotions.
meanings.sent5: The entodermal core of the fruit held all the nutrients within.
